intro: Passerina linoides, commonly known as the slender pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white. Passerina linoides is adapted to cold climates and is often found at higher elevations.
